hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.subtitle: Common questions about this template and how to use it.
hero.intro1: Here are some of the most common questions we get about the starter template. If you can't find what you're looking for, feel free to open an issue on GitHub.
hero.intro2: This project is designed to be a starting point, so many answers will depend on how you choose to extend it.

questions.question: Is this template free to use?
questions.answer: Yes, this project is open source and released under the MIT License. You can use it for personal or commercial projects without any restrictions.

questions.question: Who maintains this project?
questions.answer: This project is community-maintained. We welcome contributions from developers of all skill levels.

questions.question: Why should I use this over Next.js?
questions.answer: If you don't need server-side rendering (SSR) or complex backend features, this template offers a simpler, lighter architecture. It produces static files that can be hosted anywhere, often resulting in lower costs and better security.

questions.question: Can I use this with a CMS?
questions.answer: Absolutely. Since this is a static site generator, you can fetch content from any Headless CMS (like Contentful, Strapi, or Sanity) at build time and generate pages.

questions.question: How do I add a new route?
questions.answer: Simply add a new file to the `src/pages` directory. The file-based routing system will automatically create a route for it. For example, `src/pages/about.tsx` becomes `/about`.

questions.question: Does it support API routes?
questions.answer: No, this is a purely static frontend template. If you need backend API routes, you will need to deploy a separate backend service or use serverless functions (like Vercel Functions or AWS Lambda).

questions.question: How do I change the styling theme?
questions.answer: You can customize the theme variables in `src/index.css`. The core colors are defined as CSS variables that Tailwind uses. You can also edit `tailwind.config.js` to change fonts, spacing, and other design tokens.

questions.question: My build is failing on GitHub Actions.
questions.answer: Check the build logs for specific error messages. Common issues include missing dependencies (make sure to run `pnpm install`), type errors (run `pnpm type-check` locally), or linting issues.

questions.question: Images are not loading after deployment.
questions.answer: Ensure you are using the correct paths. Assets in the `public` directory should be referenced with a leading slash (e.g., `/logo.png`). If you are deploying to a subdirectory, you may need to set the `base` in `vite.config.ts`.
